subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Lear’s Princess overtook the Belmont Stakes winner Rags to Riches in the stretch and pulled off an upset in the $250,000 Gazelle Stakes at Belmont Park. Rags to Riches, the first filly in 102 years to win the Belmont, was sent off as the 2-5 favorite but was unable to hold off Lear’s Princess. Rags to Riches, ridden by John Velazquez, moved into the lead around the final turn, but Lear’s Princess caught her midway through the stretch and won by a half-length, covering the mile and an eighth in 1:47.86.
